column4: Microsoft phones infringe patents - U.S. Int'l Trade Commission judge
column5: NEW YORK Microsoft Corp lost a round in a potentially costly patent battle when a U.S. International Trade Commission judge on Monday found that the software giant used InterDigital Inc's technology in its mobile phones without permission.

column4: Microsoft phones infringe patents: U.S. International Trade Commission judge

column4: Altera shareholder challenges company over Intel
column5: TIG Advisors LLC  an investment firm that holds shares in Altera Corp   challenged a nomination to the company's board of  directors on Monday over Altera's refusal to engage with Intel Corp  about a potential merger.
